title: DPM Dar briefs Senate Standing Committee about Pak’s foreign policy
content:
ISLAMABAD, July 09 (APP): Deputy Prime Minister and Foreign Minister Senator Mohammad Ishaq Dar on Tuesday briefed the Senate Standing Committee on Foreign Affairs about the basic aspects of Pakistan’s foreign policy.
In the first meeting of the newly constituted Committee, he gave a detailed briefing on contours of Pakistan’s foreign policy and its priorities particularly in the context of high level engagement with strategic, traditional and regional partners as well as multilateral organizations such as the UN, OIC, SCO, D8 and others, a post on X said.
The DPM also responded to queries by the committee and informed them of important milestones achieved and  economic  and multilateral diplomacy.
